fields.System.Title: Central and federated responsibilities

Present and discuss:

  • design considerations
  • design recommendations

Discuss and document:

  • design decisions

 

Definition of done:

  • all design decisions for roles and responsibilities (central vs. federated) are made and documented
  • any required changes (brownfield) for reaching "golden state" are identified and documented

fields.System.Title: Workshop preparation
fields.System.Description:
Discuss and agree within the core team on the following:
  • who will facilitate (drive) each session (typically the Lead Architect)
  • format of the sessions (physical, virtual)
  • important tools for tracking the progress and documenting design decisions
  • background material to support the discussions (e.g., slides, diagrams, links to documentation)
  • how should attendees prepare before the sessions (Know before you go)
Definition of done:
  • each session has a clear facilitator (host)
  • meeting invitations were updated with virtual meeting links or physical addresses
  • selected tools for documenting the progress and outcome (e.g., design decisions) are ready
  • background material for each session is ready
  • session attendees were informed in advance what they should prepare and/or study (e.g. links to Enterprise Scale docs or Microsoft Learn)

fields.System.Title: Introduction session (extended team)
fields.System.Description:
Host an introduction session (scoping call) with all key resources, where you:
  • give a high-level overview of Enterprise Scale
  • explain goals and objectives for the Enterprise-scale workshop
  • introduce and emphasize the importance of design principles
  • agree on specific workshop sessions, their dates, and times, required and optional attendees
  • align expectations (how can attendees prepare for the sessions)
Definition of done:
  • all workshop sessions are planned, invitations sent, and accepted by key resources

fields.System.Title: Stakeholders and key resources mapping
fields.System.Description:
Identify and ensure participation of important stakeholders and key resources like Subject Matter Experts in the project, both internal and external (if applicable). They should be aligned with all critical design areas of Enterprise Scale.

This is particularly important for outsourced IT functions, where internal resources have limited visibility and responsibility.

Definition of done:
  • key stakeholders and SMEs are identified
  • External resources agreed to participate in the project

fields.System.Title: Identify key role holders (core team)
fields.System.Description:
Identify who will hold the following key roles in the project:
  • Sponsor
  • Project manager (Product owner)
  • Lead architect

Definition of done:
  • all key roles are nominated and approved
